fever.description: Fever is a temporary increase in body temperature, often due to an illness.
fever.advice: Monitor temperature, stay hydrated, take rest, and consult a doctor if fever persists over 3 days.

cough.description: Coughing is a reflex that helps clear airways of mucus or irritants.
cough.advice: Drink warm fluids, avoid smoking, and consult a doctor if cough lasts more than 2 weeks.

headache.description: A headache can be caused by stress, dehydration, sinus infections, or underlying health conditions.
headache.advice: Rest in a dark room, stay hydrated, and take pain relief medication if needed.

chest pain.description: Chest pain can be a sign of serious heart or lung conditions.
chest pain.advice: Seek immediate medical attention if chest pain is severe or accompanied by shortness of breath.

fatigue.description: Fatigue is persistent tiredness that can be caused by various medical conditions.
fatigue.advice: Maintain a balanced diet, get enough sleep, and consult a doctor if fatigue persists.

nausea.description: Nausea is a sensation of discomfort and the urge to vomit.
nausea.advice: Eat light foods, stay hydrated, and avoid strong odors. Seek medical help if vomiting is severe.

shortness of breath.description: Difficulty breathing can indicate respiratory or cardiac issues.
shortness of breath.advice: Avoid strenuous activities, practice deep breathing, and seek emergency care if severe.

stomach pain.description: Abdominal pain can be caused by digestive issues or infections.
stomach pain.advice: Avoid spicy foods, stay hydrated, and see a doctor if pain is persistent or worsening.

dizziness.description: Dizziness can be caused by issues with circulation, inner ear problems, or dehydration.
dizziness.advice: Sit down, drink fluids, and consult a doctor if dizziness is frequent.

joint pain.description: Joint pain can be due to inflammation, autoimmune diseases, or physical injury.
joint pain.advice: Apply ice, rest the affected joint, and seek medical advice if pain persists.
